8-11? He played in the outfield on a baseball team
Imagined his mother being kidnapped.  He was sexually molested
by his Uncle, Jesse Stayner, who was convicted of child
1972 11 molestation.  His brother, Steven Stayner, is kidnapped Dec 4th by
pedophile Kenneth Parnell. He had never seen his dad cry before
He has dark sadistic fantasies about women marching naked and
12 or being gang raped.  In 7th grade he was placed in the gifted classes.
13? He and several neighborhood boys stripped naked and ran back
and forth in front of several girls.
Sister’s friend (the neighbor) Flores Tatum is spending the night at
1977 16 this sister’s sleepover and he crept under her bed and touched her

Classmates vote Stayner the most creative student in graduating
class at Merced High School.  Graduates from High School.

column3: Steven Stayner escapes captivity with Timmy White. Steven
Stayner is reunited with his family.  Cary is very jealous of brother
because he was ignored.  He felt frustrated with Steven’s publicity.
During High School Cary is a described as a quiet loner.  A
talented cartoonist who did drawings for the school newspaper.  He
was teased often about bald spots due to his hair pulling.
JP Miller works with Stayner family to make a TV mini-series
about Steven’s kidnapping.  Cary shows pencil drawings to Miller,
and Miller suggests he should send them to colleges and Cary says
“No it’d never happen”
Tells his friend, Marchesa, after slamming his fist into plywood in
a rage that he thought he was having a nervous breakdown.He
also told his friend that he “felt like getting in his truck and driving
into the office of the glass company he worked at and killing his
boss and everybody in there and then torching the place” Sep 16th
or 20th? Brother Steven killed in a motorcycle accident at age of 24.
December his uncle is found dead in their home (Cary lived with
his uncle) after being shot to death.
Attempts suicide with Carbon Monoxide
He goes to Merced County mental health department saying he
was having a mental breakdown.  He was treated and released.
Arrested for marijuana and methamphetamine charges.  Cedar
lodge hires Cary to do odd jobs as the hotel handyman. Mobile
home is repossessed.
On Feb 15th he murders Carole Sund and Silvina Pelosso at Cedar
Lodge.  On Feb 16th he murders Juli Sund. Feb 18th? He goes
back to burn the rental car and to get Carole Sund’s wallet.On
March 18th Carol Sund's rental car is found located in Tuolumne
County.  Carole Sund and Silvina Pelosso’s bodies are found in the
trunk.  The car along with the bodies is burned and charred.
March 22nd dental records positively identify one of the two badly
burned bodies as that of Carole Sund.  March 25th Juli Sund’s
body is found based on a letter sent by Cary Stayner to the FBI.
July 15th a jury of nine men and three women are selected to hear
the trial of Cary Stayner.  July 21st Joie Ruth Armstrong is
decapitated after Cary ties her up and rapes her.  On July 22nd her
body is found.  July 23rd Stayner was questioned and released and
Stayner fails to show up for work for the first  time in a year and a
half.  July 24th Cary Stayner is arrested at Laguna Del Sol Nudist
Camp.  He asked for a good stack of child pornography and
confesses to Armstrong’s death and explains her murder.  He says
“I lost control of myself and lost control of her, and when all this
started out...I had no intentions of cutting her head off.”  July 26th
arraigned in federal court in Sacramento.
June 6th an evaluation includes results that Stayner has brain
abnormalities consistent with schizophrenia, psychotic disorder
and obsessive compulsive disorder.  July 12th Judge rules that theGovernment may seek the death penalty.  November 30th Staynerpleads guilty to the murder of Joie Armstrong.

May 22nd pleads innocent by reason of insanity.   August 26th juryreturned guilty verdicts on nine separate counts, three of first-degree murder and one of kidnapping.  Sept 16th he was deniedthe plea because his psychiatrist said he knew the differencebetween right and wrong, but could not control his violent urge.Stayner did not meet the legal standards for insanity.  Dr. JoseSilva was of several doctors who determined that Stayner waslegally sane when he killed Sund and the two teen-agers.  Silvareviewed events of Stayner’s life and said he suffered from ananxiety disorder with features of Post-traumatic Stress disorder.December Cary Stayner asks for a new trial on grounds that noneof the jurors were molestation victims.  Dec 12th sentenced todeath, by lethal injection in San Quentin, CA.
August-The Sund family accepts $1 Million wrongful deathsettlement from Cedar Lodge
